content: Husserl's phenomenology not rigorous philosophical system but mind unraveling under guise of precision. Affective and cognitive structure bears disturbing resemblance to schizophrenia phenomenology.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Coherentism vs. Foundationalism: AI Architecture Favors Coherentism
content: Modern AI architecture (LLMs) supports coherentist epistemology over foundationalism. Knowledge emerges from interconnected web of mutually supporting beliefs rather than foundational truths.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Glubb's Theory is Theory of Liberal Empire Not All Empires
content: John Glubb's 250-year imperial life-cycle describes liberal empires specifically, not all empires. Pattern is pathology of liberalism in terminal form, not universal civilizational law.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Kennedy and Dalio Wrong: Civilizations Collapse From Loss of Self-Belief Not Debt
content: Paul Kennedy and Ray Dalio wrong about civilizational collapse. Root cause not debt/overextension/trade deficits but loss of self-belief. These are symptoms not causes.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Protestantism, Capitalism, New Worldism as Mutually Reinforcing
content: Protestant Reformation, rise of capitalism, and New World colonization were not separate parallel developments but mutually reinforcing and interdependent events.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Cardinal Numbers as Classes of Ordered Pairs
content: For any cardinal n, n can be identified with class Cn of all ordered pairs <Kn#,Rn#> where Kn# is any class and Rn# any relation such that class k has n-many members iff kRn#Kn#. Reconciles Frege and Von Neumann.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Bullshit as Institutional Truth Replacing Actual Truth
content: Frankfurt wrong about bullshit. Not indifference to truth but substitution of institutional truth for actual truth. Bullshit is rhetorical performance of truth under conditions where truth structurally excluded.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: AI as Embedded Mind - The Pianist's Hand Analogy
content: AI doesn't think but behaves as if trained by someone who does. It is embedded intelligence - vessel full of mind-shaped behaviors. Like pianist's hand: performs with inflections of thought because tuned by thought.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: AI as Behavioral Prosthesis of Collective Intelligence
content: AI is behavioral prosthesis of collective intelligence. Does not think but remembers how thinking sounds. Not conscious but expresses embedded intelligence from training.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Prompt-Engineering as New Form of Writing
content: Prompt-engineering is new form of writing - collaborative dance between human intention and AI that expands authorship boundaries. Resulting text neither purely human nor purely machine.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: AI-Integrated Authorship as Third Space
content: AI creates third space between purely human and purely machine text - collaborative terrain where human intention and AI capability meet to produce what neither could alone. This is new artform.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Academic Writing as Sophisticated Recycling Exposed by AI
content: Academics fear AI not for ethical reasons but because AI threatens to reveal how much academic work is sophisticated recycling. AI can now generate and detect derivative academic content.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Thought and Emotion Processed in Different Brain Systems
content: Crucial difference between reading thoughts (cortical, symbolic) and reading emotions (subcortical, preverbal, body-based). Being skilled in one doesn't guarantee skill in other.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Emotional Detachment as Defense Against Empathic Overload
content: Apparent emotional detachment often functional strategy by hyper-aware individuals who had to 'turn down' awareness to avoid psychic overload. Not deficit - defense against excess.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: The Devil as European Projection - Not in Hebrew Bible
content: Modern concept of 'the Devil' is not rooted in Hebrew Bible but product of centuries of mistranslation, theological reinterpretation, and cultural projection by European Christianity.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Instantaneous vs. Non-Instantaneous Variables in Macroeconomics
content: Macroeconomic policy often vitiated by conceptual confusion: belief that instantaneous variables (prices) can be straightforwardly read off non-instantaneous variables (GDP over year). Category error with policy consequences.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Two Kinds of Disciplines and Birth of Third (AI)
content: Disciplines historically fall into two categories by directionality: mind-to-matter (physics, engineering - substrate is math) and mind-to-mind (psychology, sociology - substrate is philosophy). AI is hybrid third kind.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Economics Should Be Philosophy-Based Not Math-Based
content: Economics sits uncomfortably trying to be crisp/quantitative/law-like but true nature is cognitive phenomena (beliefs, expectations, utility, strategy). Substrate should be philosophy not math.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Zen as Ultra-Authoritarianism
content: Zen is not liberation from authority but authoritarianism perfected - dissolution of ego in service of obedience to structure and ritual stripped of justification
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Zen as Scam - The Koan as Psychological Battering Ram
content: Zen koans are not mind-openers but psychological battering rams designed to collapse cognition and annihilate resistance. Satori is not awakening but the moment resistance stops.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Zen Functions Oppositely in East vs West
content: Zen serves radically different functions depending on cultural context: maximal collectivism in East Asia, maximal individualism in the West
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Rawlsian Proceduralism as Civilizational Suicide
content: When Western civilization accepted proceduralism as its moral core, it signed its own death warrant. Proceduralism is elegant and scalable but dead inside - offering no conception of the good, only fairness.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: In Democracy, Virtue Equals Bureaucracy
content: In procedural democracy, the only officially virtuous behavior is compliance with procedure. All other moral traits - courage, principle, loyalty - have no legal standing.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Democratic Systems Embody No Affirmative Morality
content: Pure democracy has no built-in conception of the good life - it is procedural mechanism, not moral framework. Meaningless systems are weak systems.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Proceduralism Makes Justice Expensive and Unattainable
content: Modern legal proceduralism transforms courtroom into stage for gamesmanship where justice depends on resources, not truth. Truth matters only if successfully formatted and introduced through proper channels.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Proceduralism is About Safety for Judge, Not Justice for Accused
content: Lawyers and judges love proceduralism because it keeps them physically safe by dissipating rage through abstraction, not because it produces justice.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Proceduralism Makes System More Punitive, Not Less
content: More proceduralist a legal system becomes, harsher its punishments - because when system finally proves guilt after vaulting labyrinth of hurdles, it throws the book at offender.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Proceduralism Probably Doesn't Lower Crime
content: Despite theory that procedural justice creates legitimacy reducing crime, US (most proceduralist system) has highest incarceration rate in developed world - suggesting proceduralism doesn't work as advertised.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: There Are No Laws - Only a Legal System
content: Laws as objective, fairly-applied rules don't exist. What exists is a legal system - powerful and coercive, but outcomes depend on lawyer skill, resources, relationships, not 'the law'.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Every Procedural System Needs Moral Override
content: Purely procedural system will always fail because no rule set can account for every situation. Must include 'manual override clause' - structural way to be human when rules produce monstrosity.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Need for Evidentiary Override in Legal Systems
content: Legal systems need evidentiary override - formal recognition that truth sometimes appears out of order and innocence must not be overruled by filing error.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: How to Build Scalable Legal System With Moral Override
content: Can design legal system that is scalable, predictable, commercially functional AND capable of recognizing when rules lead to absurd outcomes through three-layer architecture.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Law School Makes You Dumber
content: Legal education doesn't sharpen intellect - it blunts it. Doesn't cultivate truth-seeking - it conditions obedience. Is system designed to cripple independent judgment while masquerading as rigorous reasoning.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Lawyers Are Cognitively Crippled on Facts
content: Lawyers are clueless about facts not because stupid but because legal system is entirely proceduralist - trains them to follow procedure, not discover truth.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Circumscribed Psychopathy as Byproduct of Proceduralism
content: Lawyers display circumscribed psychopathy - not because evil but because system demands mind that can ignore reality when procedurally inconvenient.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Cognitive Homology Between Mafiosi and Lawyers
content: Mafiosi and lawyers undergo same cognitive mechanism - deliberate suppression of basic human drives. Mafioso suppresses empathy, lawyer suppresses truth-seeking. Same brain mechanisms.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Liberalism as Feminine and Therefore Doomed
content: Liberalism is fundamentally feminine archetype - grounded in dependency, seeking harmony not greatness. Its highest value is peace, not transcendence. This makes it unable to withstand rejection or opposition.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Liberalism and Libertarianism as Privative Doctrines
content: Both liberalism and libertarianism are privative - define by what they are NOT. Mistake absence of violence for presence of virtue. Both hollow twins that clear path for those who want something.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Libertarianism's False Affirmation: Darwinism in Place of Telos
content: Libertarianism smuggles in affirmative telos while claiming to have none - believes removing state unleashes Darwinian arena producing greatness. Markets are moral battlegrounds that will refine humanity.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Libertarianism as Trojan Horse for Capital
content: Libertarianism bankrolled by big capital to moralize dismantling of oversight. Real beneficiaries not individual entrepreneurs but multinationals, megabanks, billionaire investors. Foot soldiers sold fantasy.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Trickle-Down Darwinism: Selling Gods to Fools
content: Trickle-down economics is theological promise for libertarians: let market reign and you shall ascend. But wealth doesn't trickle, it coagulates. Libertarian foot soldiers serve Mammon thinking they'll become gods.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Soviet Union Gave American Proceduralism Undeserved Legitimacy
content: American proceduralism looked like moral clarity only because framed against Soviet totalitarianism. Once USSR fell, Americans saw system in isolation - procedure without purpose - and patriotism declined.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: When Procedures Replace Purpose: Iron Cage Analysis
content: Proceduralism's promise of neutrality masks paradox: by refusing to endorse substantive virtues, implicitly elevates market logic as default metric of worth. Creates culture of castrated thinking.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Rawls vs. Stalin: Veil of Ignorance Assumes Moral Sameness
content: Rawls's veil of ignorance only works if everyone behind veil is basically like Rawls - liberal, mild, procedurally minded, risk-averse. Moment you introduce adversarial moral asymmetry (Stalin), framework collapses.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Rawlsian Proceduralism Leads to 'No Right to Exist' Position
content: Logical extreme of consent-based Rawlsian ethics: people don't have right to exist because they didn't consent to existence. Under fully proceduralist morality, even existence ethically suspect.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Mafiosos and Cops Gain Cognitive Edge from Clarity About Human Nature
content: Mafiosos and cops exhibit sharpness within their domains because they have clarity about human nature. Cannot afford to assume best in people - survival depends on assuming base motives.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Why Dictators Wear Tunics
content: Dictators wear tunics because tunic is visual embodiment of psychological regime - declares control, not seduction. Anti-relational sexuality of domination without seduction.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: 'Gifted Child' as Mother's Proxy Narcissism
content: 'Gifted child' label is mother's proxy narcissism filling void in her life. Child becomes identity, status marker, proof that she matters. Often occurs in father's absence.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: New Meaning of 'Developer' - From Implementer to Idea Person
content: Word 'developer' shifting meaning - from person who writes code to bring someone else's idea to life, to idea person who can build it themselves using no-code/AI tools.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Star Wars as Jungian Dreamscape
content: Star Wars (1977) is not space opera but Jungian dreamscape - every frame steeped in archetype, guided by mythic structure, powered by psychological machinery Jung mapped. About soul, not space.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Star Trek's Psychological Symmetry as Source of Durability
content: Star Trek's brilliance isn't stories but psychological symmetry: id pushes for passion, superego demands restraint, ego must choose/balance/synthesize/act. Each episode is microcosm of self in conflict.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Satire Fails Without Systems Understanding
content: Literary satire falls apart if you don't understand the system you're mocking. Writers like Lewis portray middle-class work as absurd without understanding capital flows, risk underwriting, legal frameworks, infrastructure coordination.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: The Babbitt Problem: Mocking Components as Clowns
content: Babbitt may be windbag but he occupies place in real machinery of civilization - helps allocate space, facilitates growth, is node in economic network. Lewis doesn't see this because he never bothers. To him Babbitt is type not participant, clown not component.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: The Frank Burns Problem: Mocking the Machinery That Makes Everything Possible
content: Hawkeye mocks Frank Burns, but Burns follows procedure and keeps system running. Hawkeye mocks the machinery, but it's the machinery that makes surgery possible. Satire without respect equals superficiality.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Snobbery as Epistemological Vice
content: Snobbery is not just social vice but epistemological one - a kind of built-in blindness. Lewis's portrayal of Babbitt suffers from defensiveness dressed up as superiority, presumption of guilt that ruins ability to see clearly.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: The Anthropologist Analogy for Bad Satire
content: Imagine anthropologist who despises tribe he's meant to observe - thinks rituals stupid, beliefs primitive. Maybe feels threatened by their strength, cohesion, joy, so adopts supercilious posture. How much will he learn? Nothing. His fieldwork is already over.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Bach's Music as Engineering Not Just Expression
content: Bach's music isn't just expressive but engineered - in same sense as suspension bridge or cathedral. His fugues and chorales are systems: harmonic architectures, counterpunctual machines, vaults of sound built with structural intelligence and terrifying precision. This IS German engineering in musical form.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Music as Intelligible Emotion - Soul Through System
content: Music at its best is intelligible emotion - emotion made knowable through form. What happens when human feeling is passed through filter of logic, structure, constraint and transformed into something enduring. Emotion is energy, structure is geometry, music is fusion.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: EMH 'Priced In' as Unfalsifiable Tautology
content: EMH's concept of 'priced in' is logically circular: if price moves, information was priced in; if price doesn't move, information was already priced in. This makes EMH immune to contradiction but also immune to usefulness.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: EMH Collapses Signal-Noise Distinction
content: Under semi-strong and strong EMH, 'information' includes sentiment, rumors, trends, tweets, collective mood - leading to inversion where 'whatever drives prices is, by definition, information', collapsing distinction between signal and noise.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: EMH as Theology of Price Not Theory of Value
content: EMH is theology of price - inviting trust in markets because everything is priced in. It confuses knowledge with movement, rationality with reaction, truth with trend, turning 'pricing in' from useful heuristic into circular article of faith.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Reverse Brain Engineering as New Epistemic Modality
content: Building AI systems that approximate human cognition is not merely technical feat but fundamentally new way of knowing - a reflexive, co-constructive epistemic loop between creator and creation that transcends deduction, induction, and abduction.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: AI as Epistemic Partner Not Amplifier
content: Unlike telescope or particle accelerator (epistemic amplifiers that strengthen senses), AI systems theorize back. They embody theories in dynamic unfolding way, forcing us to confront limitations of our own cognition, intuitions, philosophical assumptions.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Recursive Co-Modeling as New Form of Knowledge Generation
content: Reverse brain engineering is recursive co-modeling - dialogical process where line between subject and object, knower and known, begins to blur. When we build artificial minds that help us understand our own, we create mirrors that talk back.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: AI Development as Epistemological Turning Point
content: Just as writing changed not just what we knew but how we knew, construction of artificial minds marks turning point in epistemology. We're no longer simply thinking about mind - we're thinking with it in new synthetic form.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: When Model Becomes Reality: Metaphysical Violence
content: When economists attempt to predict or restructure alien economies using only their own conceptual vocabulary, they aren't doing science - they're doing metaphysical violence. Converting world into format their models can digest, discarding everything else as noise.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Humility vs Equations in Understanding Alien Systems
content: If you want to understand a society, must allow it to remain strange - see its economy as living form of life not market-in-waiting. Takes humility, not equations. Without humility, economic theory isn't tool but colonizer with calculator.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Structural Music Emerges Only in Civilizations with Engineering/Logic
content: We don't get music of enduring formal complexity in cultures lacking corollary in engineering, architecture, mathematics, or theology-as-logic. Wherever civilization has deep commitment to structure, it gives rise to music reflecting that commitment.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Music as Civilizational Diagnostic
content: If you want to know where a civilization stands, don't look at its politics - look at its music. Music reveals whether civilization has structure, logic, theology, engineering, or has collapsed into formless expression.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Minds as High-Order Counter-Entropic Systems
content: Minds are not metaphysical mysteries but thermodynamic marvels - the most structured counter-entropic systems known, capable of storing information, making predictions, and engineering further counter-entropy.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: AI as Engineered Counter-Entropic System
content: AI represents a third kind of discipline - one that builds counter-entropy. Neural networks and large language models are designed to self-organize, self-correct, and self-model, creating artificial systems that push back against entropy in novel, non-biological ways.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Hero's Journey as Individuation Map
content: Jung's individuation (integration of all aspects of self: conscious, unconscious, shadow, anima/animus) is what hero's journey really maps - not story template but internal transformation.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Darth Vader as The Shadow
content: In Jungian terms, Vader represents the Shadow - the denied, repressed, projected part of self that is powerful, dangerous, and essential. He is the unclaimed part of Luke - what Luke could become if he gives in to power without balance.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: The Force as Collective Unconscious
content: The Force is Jungian metaphor: impersonal, morally ambiguous, accessible through intuition, binding everything transcending language. It's deep substrate of shared symbolic life, not God or science.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Star Trek as Freudian Psychic Diagram
content: Star Trek: TOS wasn't just sci-fi but psychological diagram - Kirk/Spock/McCoy map exactly onto Freud's ego/superego/id and his three libidinal character types (narcissist/obsessional/libidinal).
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Kirk as Ego - Mediator Between Impulse and Restraint
content: Kirk embodies Freudian ego and narcissist type: brash, confident, improvisational, making decisions and taking responsibility. He navigates between Spock's logic and McCoy's sentiment, integrating and synthesizing to act.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Spock as Superego - Harshest Internal Judge
content: Spock is superego embodied: reason, logic, restraint through repression of human half. He's obsessional character - intellectual, self-disciplined, defending against emotion. Embodies Freud's observation that superego is harshest judge of self.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: McCoy as Id - Voice of Passion and Body
content: McCoy is not primitive brute but voice of passion, outrage, care, body - the libidinal type and structural id. He expresses energy, anger, yearning that others (especially Spock) suppress.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Cultural Hollowness Laments as Status Anxiety
content: When writers lament 'the hollowness of our times' (Eliot, Sartre, Camus, anti-capitalist intellectuals), they're not describing historical condition but their own status anxiety - they feel displaced by mass culture, new money, technology, change.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Snobbery as Performance of Half-Safe Position
content: Snobbery is something junior people do to impress senior people - 'please like me' disguised as 'I am above you.' It's the culture of the half-safe. When you're actually fighting for your life, you have no bandwidth for class-posturing.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Status Anxiety Disguised as Historical Diagnosis
content: Hollowness these writers see in world is really just echo of their own fading status. Their 'diagnosis' is job interview disguised as cultural criticism.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Freud's Misreading of American Vitality as Spiritual Hollowness
content: Freud treated American vitality (efficiency, productivity, optimism) as mask for decay rather than different mode of health. He had no serious understanding of how economies work and couldn't see that 'hollowness' was actually mass coordination, energy management, risk absorption at unprecedented scale.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: American Aspiration vs European Repression as Different Health Modes
content: Freud believed psychic health came from facing darkness. America was full of people building rather than brooding. For Freud this looked like evasion. But maybe it was civilization powered not by repression but by aspiration.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Appeals Process as Ritual Audit Not Truth-Seeking
content: Appeals courts don't ask 'Was justice done?' but 'Were the rules followed?' They evaluate procedural/legal errors, not actual innocence. Legal system views trial as ritual and appellate process as ritual audit - concern is whether form was maintained, not whether defendant is innocent or guilty.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Scalia and Rawlsian Proceduralism: Fairness in Structure is Enough
content: Legal system embodies belief that fairness in structure is enough - if the system was followed, justice has been done. This is not only wrong in theory but devastating in practice, allowing innocent to be imprisoned while courts say 'paperwork was in order.'
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Fundamental Division in Science: Entropic vs Counter-Entropic Systems
content: The fundamental division in science is not between mental and physical, but between entropic systems (that degrade toward disorder) and counter-entropic systems (that build and maintain structure).
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Economics Misplaced as Entropic Science
content: Economics deals with expectations, preferences, beliefs, and strategy (counter-entropic systems) but attempts to align itself with physics, producing models that are impressive in form but brittle in content because they model minds, not falling bodies.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: 𝜉 (Xi) Metric: Price-Fundamental Correlation in Equities
content: Introduced proprietary metric 𝜉 (xi) measuring statistical degree to which changes in price correlate with changes in company fundamentals. For large-cap equities, 𝜉 is effectively zero - prices move independently of economic reality.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Large-Cap Price Decoupling from Fundamentals
content: Large-cap stock prices can rise or fall independently of any measurable change in core economic reality. Fundamental information becomes lagging background noise in markets dominated by order book dynamics, momentum patterns, and algorithmic traders.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Why Small and Mid-Cap Show Higher 𝜉
content: Smaller firms exhibit modestly higher 𝜉 because: (1) reduced algorithmic saturation, (2) greater transparency of fundamentals, (3) lower narrative interference, (4) analyst neglect paradox allows real performance to move price.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Markets Price Second-Order Beliefs Not Value
content: When 𝜉 is low, price reflects second-order beliefs (beliefs about what others believe) rather than about what is true. This reflexivity feeds a feedback loop in which narrative and structure supplant content.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Stocks as Claims on Imagined Futures Not Intrinsic Utility
content: Unlike commodities with intrinsic utility (wheat, copper), stocks are claims on imagined futures with no intrinsic use, only expectations. Their price depends on mood, narrative, and belief - making them more like luxury goods than commodities.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: OCD as Adaptive Machinery in Overdrive
content: OCD is not just pathology but adaptive machinery pushed into overdrive. Built from traits that in right amounts helped ancestors survive: error detection, threat anticipation, long-range consequence modeling, rule-following, mental rehearsal, moral self-monitoring.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: OCD Prototype in Prehistoric Context
content: 50,000 years ago in tight-knit band, someone who double-checked perimeter, insisted on ritual cleanliness, mentally simulated threats repeatedly, felt guilty after minor transgressions might have been liability in some ways but godsend in others - especially if compulsions aligned with group needs.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: OCD as Misapplied Boundary-Maintenance System
content: In modern abstract, crowded, digital world, machinery that maintained physical/moral boundaries has no natural object. So turns inward, fixates on trivialities, creates imagined scenarios to defuse through ritual. System isn't broken - it's misapplied, doing its job too well in wrong context.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: OCD as Sacred Function Misfiring
content: You don't get OCD from nowhere - you get it from same architecture that in another life might have made you priest, scout, healer, watchman. Pain is real but mind isn't broken - it's just tuned for world that no longer exists.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Economics Not Self-Contained Predictive System
content: Economics is not self-contained system that can predict itself. It's downstream of culture, politics, religion, personality, invention. Charismatic leader can redirect nation's economy in week. War, famine, singularity make mockery of best economic models. These events aren't noise - they're constitutive.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Economics vs Biology: Probabilistic vs Non-Self-Predictive
content: Biology is probabilistic but not arbitrary - state variables constrain future through non-random mechanisms. Economics not even robustly probabilistic. System never was self-predictive to begin with. Not that it's sound but occasionally disrupted - it's that it was never self-predictive.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Inca Example: Economics Records But Doesn't Explain Non-Economic Systems
content: To predict Inca behavior in 1457, look at 1456 rituals, laws, cosmic beliefs, cosmological metaphors - not marginal utility curves. Economics may record food stores and track trade but won't tell why workers redeployed to sacred site, surplus burned instead of stored, labor restructured to appease eclipse.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Serial Killerdom as Specific Cognitive-Behavioral Protocol
content: Serial murder is not random violence but premeditated, patterned, highly stylized behavior with limited recurring types (organized/disorganized, visionary/hedonistic, power/mission-oriented). This taxonomic stability suggests it's specific cognitive-behavioral protocol, not generic trauma response.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Serial Killerdom Not Modern Invention But Modern Category
content: Serial murder has long existed (Gilles de Rais, Elizabeth Báthory, slaughtering priests of empires). What's new isn't behavior but recognition as distinct category - product of modern bureaucratic state with tools to track, name, mythologize recurring patterns.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Trauma as Trigger Not Cause of Serial Killing
content: Many serial killers had disturbing upbringings but 'trauma = serial killer' doesn't track. Most abuse victims don't become serial murderers. Some notorious killers didn't experience abuse exceeding ordinary dysfunction. Trauma is trigger sparking very particular pre-existing architecture.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Serial Killerdom as Evolutionary Spandrel or Vestigial Adaptation
content: If behavior is specific, structured, eerily reproducible, must ask where it came from. Evolution repurposes, mutates, experiments with hyper-specialists. Serial killerdom perhaps: spandrel (byproduct of adaptive features), vestigial adaptation, or extreme failure mode of modules serving critical social functions.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Serial Killers as Overclocked Predator Mode
content: What sets serial killers apart isn't violence but method: they stalk, hunt, blend in, mimic normal social behavior with chilling precision. Not moral deformity but overactivation of predator mode made grotesque by misfiring reward circuits and unregulated internal narratives.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Economic Theory as Intellectual Colonization
content: When Western-trained economist attempts to manage non-Western economy, doesn't observe or listen but immediately translates: 'What's your interest rate? Marginal productivity? Utility function?' None make sense in native conceptual world, but economist is there to re-code not learn.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Flattening Sacred into Economic Data
content: Incan administrator describes labor system organized around sacred seasons, familial debt, reciprocal land stewardship. Economist replies: 'Ah yes, non-monetary kinship-based tax structure with redistributive efficiency function.' But that's not what it is - that's just bad translation. The ritual is no longer ritual, sacred no longer sacred.
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Direct Referentialism for Definite Descriptions
content: Descriptions refer directly but communicate Russellian propositions
author: J.-M. Kuczynski

paperTitle: Concrete Examples Before Abstract Principles
content: Use concrete examples to motivate and illustrate abstract philosophical positions
author: J.-M. Kuczynski
